data.title: ECMA-262 - Ecma International
data.description: ECMAScript® 2024 language specification, 15th edition - ECMAScript is a programming language based on several technologies like JavaScript.

ECMA-262
========

ECMAScript® 2024 language specification

15th edition, June 2024

**This Standard defines the ECMAScript 2024 general-purpose programming language.**

Kindly note that **the normative copy is the HTML version**; the PDF version has been produced to generate a printable document.

This 15th edition has been prepared under the Ecma RF patent policy.

Please note that for ECMAScript Edition 4 the Ecma standard number “ECMA-262 Edition 4” was reserved but not used in the Ecma publication process. Therefore “ECMA-262 Edition 4” as an Ecma International publication does not exist.

The latest drafts are available at: [https://tc39.es/ecma262/](https://tc39.es/ecma262/). Reporters should generally only file bugs if the bug is still present in the latest drafts.

Please find hereafter the place to file bugs: [https://github.com/tc39/ecma262#ecmascript](https://github.com/tc39/ecma262#ecmascript).

[Download this standard](https://ecma-international.org/wp-content/uploads/ECMA-262_15th_edition_june_2024.pdf)[View in HTML](https://262.ecma-international.org/15.0/index.html)

Classification
--------------

**Category**[Software engineering and interfaces](https://ecma-international.org/publications-and-standards/standards?order=category#Software-engineering-and-interfaces)

**Subcategory**ECMAScript®

**Technical Committee**[TC39](https://ecma-international.org/technical-committees/tc39/)

This site uses cookies. By continuing to browse the site, you are agreeing to our use of cookies.

[Accept](https://ecma-international.org/publications-and-standards/standards/ecma-262/#)[Manage](https://ecma-international.org/publications-and-standards/standards/ecma-262/#)

### Cookie and privacy settings

  

  

Necessary cookies

Analytics cookies

Additional services

Privacy policy

Necessary cookies

Essential cookies are strictly necessary for the proper operation of our site. In particular, they govern the principles of navigation and memorize some of your choices between pages. If you refuse them, your browsing experience may be affected.

Analytics cookies

Analysis cookies collect statistical and anonymous information on the traffic recorded on our site. They help us to improve our pages, in order to better meet our users' expectations. If you do not want us to record your visit, you can disable this tracking.

Click to enable/disable Google Analytics tracking.

Additional services

We also use various external services such as Google WebFonts and Google Maps. These providers may collect data such as your IP address. If you deactivate these cookies, the appearance of our site may have a negative impact on your reading experience. Changes will take effect once you reload the page.

Click to enable/disable Google Webfonts.

  

Click to enable/disable Google Maps.

Privacy policy

You can find out more about our use of cookies on our [privacy policy page.](https://www.ecma-international.org/policies/privacy-policy/)

[Save](https://ecma-international.org/publications-and-standards/standards/ecma-262/# "Allow to use cookies, you always can modify used cookies and services")[Deactivate all cookies](https://ecma-international.org/publications-and-standards/standards/ecma-262/# "Do not allow to use cookies or services. Some functionality on our site might not work as expected.")

Check to enable permanent hiding of message bar and refuse all cookies if you do not opt in. We need 2 cookies to store this setting. Otherwise you will be prompted again when opening a new browser window or new a tab.

Click to enable/disable essential site cookies.
